intro: Galium andrewsii var. gatense, commonly known as the Gatens galium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves and stems are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
